title: (x) Looking for a website where you can preview fonts - various {Jan E, Mike Y}
content:
I forgot the name of the website where you can type a word of your own choosing and then see how it looks when you use different fonts. Anyone know what I’m talking about?

Thx,  
Jean

 [‹ Tech sans on "New York Architecture Game" cover'](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201072844/http:/typophile.com/node/47874 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Soda" geometric stencil display face - Futura Black {Stephen} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201072844/http:/typophile.com/node/47880 "Go to next forum topic")
author: meanjean

comments.content:
Also [Fonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201072844/http:/www.fonts.com/), [Veer.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201072844/http:/www.veer.com/products/type/), [Linotype](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201072844/http:/www.linotype.com/) and [Phil’s Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201072844/http:/www.philsfonts.com/) just to name the other big ones. The fact is that most vendor sites give you a way to test out their fonts. Some do it better than others.

- Mike Yanega
